Description: Oval, pale blue-grey chalcedony stamp-seal or scaraboid with slight domed back, perforated. Engraved on the flat front surface with ground line; worshipper in long garment gesturing with one visible hand - a Babylonian trait - while pointing finger as in the Assyrian gesture; incised inscription around figure. Small patches of deposit; slightly chipped.
Curator's comments: It is the elements 'hd' and 'rqy' rather than the script that indicate the seal's Aramaic character. Our seal owner was a high official of an unknown Aramaean king.
Bibliographic references: Avigad & Sass 1997a / Corpus of West Semitic Stamp Seals (751)

Condition: Fair; small patches of deposit; slightly chipped.
